placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Heritance Kandalama – A Masterpiece of Luxury & Nature
My stay at Heritance Kandalama was nothing short of extraordinary! Designed by the renowned architect Geoffrey Bawa, this eco-luxury hotel blends seamlessly with its natural surroundings, offering a breathtaking experience in the heart of Sri Lanka’s cultural triangle.

Location & Ambience
Perched on the edge of the Kandalama Lake, this stunning hotel is surrounded by lush greenery, rocky cliffs, and abundant wildlife. The architecture is a masterpiece—built into the mountainside, making it feel like an extension of nature itself. The views of Sigiriya Rock Fortress in the distance add to the magic of this place.

Rooms & Comfort
The rooms are spacious, elegantly designed, and offer spectacular lake or jungle views. The floor-to-ceiling windows bring nature right into the room. I woke up to the sound of birds and the sight of monkeys playing in the trees outside my balcony. The luxurious bathroom with a rain shower and a deep bathtub made my stay even more relaxing.

Dining Experience
The buffet at Kanchana Restaurant was one of the best I’ve experienced, offering a mix of Sri Lankan and international cuisine. The quality of the food, fresh ingredients, and live cooking stations made every meal special. The rooftop dining experience with panoramic views of the lake was truly unforgettable.

Facilities & Activities
Infinity Pools – The iconic infinity pool overlooking the jungle and lake is breathtaking, perfect for a relaxing swim.

Ayurvedic Spa – A must-try! The treatments were rejuvenating, set in a serene environment.

Nature Walks & Bird Watching – The hotel is home to many bird species, making it ideal for nature lovers.

Cycling & Excursions – The hotel organizes tours to Sigiriya, Dambulla Cave Temple, and Minneriya National Park for wildlife safaris.

Service & Hospitality
The staff were exceptionally friendly and attentive. Every request was met with a smile, and their hospitality made me feel truly welcome.

Best Time to Visit
The hotel is beautiful year-round, but the dry season (May to September) is ideal for sightseeing and wildlife experiences.

Overall Verdict
⭐ 5/5 – Heritance Kandalama is not just a hotel; it’s an experience. Whether you’re looking for luxury, nature, or culture, this hotel offers it all. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Sri Lanka!
title: Highly recommend

ownerResponse/text: Dear Heidistock,….. It’s wonderful to hear that you enjoyed your stay and appreciated the way the hotel blends into its surroundings. Taking a dip in the infinity pool is truly a special experience, and we’re glad you had the chance to enjoy it along with our other pools. The breathtaking views from the Sigiriya Wing, the variety of dining options, and the warm hospitality of our team are all things we take pride in, so knowing they added to your experience means a lot. And yes, our curious little visitors do like to make themselves at home—thank you for the reminder to keep the doors closed! We’d love to welcome you back for another relaxing and nature-filled stay. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: Wunderschönes Hotel das sich perfekt in die Landschaft fügt. Schwimmen im Infinitiv Pool ein Traum, es gibt noch zwei weitere Pools. Zimmer sehr sauber mit herrlichem Blick (Sigeriya Wing) und regelmäßigen Gästen. (Affen), daher Türen immer geschlossen halten. Essen mit einer riesigen Auswahl und sehr freundliches Personal.
title: Traumhaftes Hotel

ownerResponse/text: Dear Lesley …. Thank you for your gracious words of praise. It’s heartwarming to hear you recall your experience so fondly. Our team is always ready to assist our valued guests, and Asanka and Madusanka take great pride in ensuring that rooms are maintained to the highest standards. Your appreciation of their efforts means a lot to us. We take great joy in showcasing the natural beauty that surrounds Heritance Kandalama, and we’re delighted that you had the opportunity to explore it with Nalinda. Being at the heart of a cultural treasure trove, our location offers easy access to many fascinating sites, and we’re glad these experiences enriched your stay in Sri Lanka. Thank you for choosing to spend seven days with us. We look forward to welcoming you back for another memorable and relaxing stay. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Explore the surrounding area. The hotel will help book a tuk tuk if you dont have a driver.
text:
We stayed for seven nights at the Kandalama hotel. What an amazing place! The bedroom was roomy, cleaned daily  and the bed was very comfortable. The food was great with lots of different dishes  to choose from every day- I'm vegetarian and there was lots for me to choose from. There was masses for meat eaters too. 
All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly- nothing was too much trouble. Special thanks to Asanka and Modasanka who made sure our room was comfortable and clean- all the staff were gracious though, we just didnt catch their names!
 We tried all 3 swimming pools and found them all fab but would have appreciated some shaded areas around the poolside, but that is a small quibble as the ambience around all the pools was calm and peaceful-the views were good too. 
We really enjoyed seeing the monkeys ( macaques and langurs) from the balcony (and made sure to keep our balcony door locked when we were out as the macaques were very clever and determined little critters!).
We went on the jungle walk with Narinder, the resident naturalist and on another day took a tuk tuk to the Cave temples at Dambulla which are so beautiful. We also went to Pophams arboretum (near Dambulla) and thoroughly enjoyed our visit there. Just taking walks around the hotel and to the eco area  was enjoyable too.
We appreciated all the wildlife ( eg lizards, birds, butterflies) around the site and for us that was the 'icing on the cake' and ensured our stay gave us memories to last a lifetime.
title: Amazing hotel, fantastic food and gracious staff.

ownerResponse/text: Dear Euey …It’s great to hear you had such a wonderful experience! We’re glad our young chefs impressed you with their skills and warm hospitality, and that your personal waiter made the evening feel extra special. Sudith will be happy to know his efforts were appreciated. We hope you have fun trying out the cooking tips at home and reminiscing about your time Heritance Kandalama. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Check to see if you have double booked your self. We did . Our guide went to great lengths to ensure we did all Three options. We were tired but so pleased he convinced us .
text:
What a great experience. Our 2 young chefs did their employer proud. So pleasant and competent. Our own personal waiter made us feel like royalty.
The food produced was outstanding and we will be trying their hints as soon as we're home! Thanks Sudith for going out of his way to set this up for us
title: Cooking class at Kandalama

ownerResponse/text: Dear Kate …Thank you for sharing your thoughts on your experience with us. Geoffrey Bawa’s vision truly shines through in the way Heritance Kandalama blends seamlessly with its surroundings, and we’re delighted that you appreciated the architectural brilliance behind it. The integration of natural elements, from the open spaces to the carefully designed furnishings, creates an atmosphere that is both tranquil and inspiring. We're also glad you enjoyed the unique pool settings, each offering a distinct perspective of the breathtaking landscape. It was a pleasure having you with us, and we hope to welcome you back for another stay immersed in nature and timeless design. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: An extraordinary accomplishment. This 7 floored building is deceptive as it sits quietly within the landscape. Unobtrusive yet magnificent in so many ways. Another splendid example of the brilliance of Sri Lankan architect, Geoffrey Bawa, whose designs were driven by a wish to sit a building within nature. Natural light and natural ventilation are found in general areas while the bedrooms have AC as required . The hotel is full of  furniture he designed which again displays an elegant simplicity.  There are 3 swimming pools all cleverly located including one which is built on a rock.
title: An extraordinary accomplishment

ownerResponse/text: Dear Pillipa,… It’s wonderful to hear that you enjoyed experiencing Heritance Kandalama as part of your Geoffrey Bawa tour. His ability to integrate architecture so seamlessly with nature is truly remarkable, and this hotel stands as a testament to his vision. The way it emerges from the jungle only upon arrival is part of its unique charm, making it feel like a hidden retreat. We're delighted that you found it to be a highlight of your journey through Bawa’s work. Thank you for visiting, and we hope you’ll have the chance to return for another stay immersed in his architectural brilliance. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: Set into the jungle backdrop this hotel is a perfect example of Geoffrey Bawa architecture. When driving in on the narrow country road the hotel is not obvious until you are at the front door. We were on a tour of Bawa projects throughout Sri Lanka and this one is a must see!
title: “Jungle modernist “ accommodation at its best

ownerResponse/text: Dear Ben…. Thank you for your thoughtful review. It’s great to hear that Geoffrey Bawa’s architectural brilliance and the hotel’s natural ambiance stood out to you. We’re also pleased that our team’s warmth and professionalism contributed to your experience. We regret that the à la carte offerings didn’t meet your expectations. Your feedback is valuable, and we will certainly take it into account as we look for ways to enhance the dining experience to cater to a wider range of preferences. Regarding the overall atmosphere and upkeep, we understand your perspective. Continuous efforts are in place to refresh our spaces while maintaining the minimalist, rustic charm that defines the hotel’s character. Striking the right balance between heritage and modern comfort remains a priority. We hope to welcome you again in the future. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
The Heritance Kandalama is undeniably beautiful. Geoffrey Bawa’s architecture is nothing short of phenomenal and remains inspiring decades on. The setting and design are breathtaking, and the staff are consistently warm, helpful, and professional. The buffet is vibrant and full of variety, but unfortunately the set menu doesn’t quite live up to the same five-star promise.

However, as you spend time here, the hotel's age begins to show. Key areas feel tired, and despite the presence of other guests, the ambiance is surprisingly lifeless. The grand sculptural entrance leads to an empty café and a bar so underwhelming you might miss it altogether. What this hotel needs is a serious interior refresh and an injection of energy to match the brilliance of its architectural foundation. It's a place that deserves to feel as alive as it looks.
title: Architectural Masterpiece in Need of New Life

ownerResponse/text: Dear Dorothy…. It’s wonderful to hear about your experience at Heritance Kandalama. Your vivid description of the hotel, nestled along the hillside with stunning views of the jungle and lake, really brings Geoffrey Bawa’s architectural brilliance to life. It’s always a pleasure to hear guests appreciate how the hotel blends so naturally with the surrounding landscape. We’re glad to know that you enjoyed the variety of dishes at the buffet and the attentive service from our team. As for the monkeys—what a fun, albeit cheeky, addition to the experience. We love how they seem to make their own appearances on the balconies, though we do advise keeping a safe distance from the little “streetwise thieves.” A balloon flight at sunrise is truly an unforgettable way to see the area, and we’re happy you were able to experience it. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future for more moments like these. Warm Regards,  General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: About 1 hour 50 minutes from Anuradhapura or Polonnaruwa. Jungle setting, so not ideal for taking a stroll out.
text: A unique experience in this Geoffrey Bawa designed edifice. The hotel runs along the hillside and is open to the landscape: rock at the back, jungle and lake views to the front. A wide selection of foods at the buffet and attentive servers. Expect visits from monkeys on the balconies, but do not encourage as they are street wise thieves! We highly recommend a balloon flight; the launch site is a short drive away and the views as the sun rises spectacular.
title: Unique experience

herzlichen Dank für Ihre wunderbare Rückmeldung und dafür, dass Sie sich die Zeit genommen haben, Ihre Eindrücke mit uns zu teilen.

Wir hoffen, Sie bald wieder bei uns begrüßen zu dürfen

The large infinity pool area was a highlight—beautifully maintained and perfect for relaxing while enjoying the peaceful, calm surroundings. The serene environment added to the overall experience, making it the ideal place to unwind and recharge.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for choosing The Grand Hotel for your 3-night stay and for taking the time to share such a thoughtful and comprehensive review.

We are truly delighted to know that you found our property “truly grand” — from the breathtaking grounds and charming architecture to the variety of dining options and the overall ambience. It’s heartening to hear that our reception team made a warm first impression and that you appreciated the comfort of our spacious rooms in the cool climes of Nuwara Eliya.

We also value your candid feedback regarding the service at the à la carte restaurant and breakfast buffet. Please accept our sincere apologies for the lapse in attentiveness you encountered. This is certainly not reflective of the high standards we strive to uphold, and your comments have been shared with our operations team to ensure improvements are made.

Thank you once again for your kind words and constructive insights. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back for an even more seamless experience in the near future.

Warm regards,
The Management
The Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya
placeInfo/address: Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya - Heritage Grand
text:
We stayed 3 nights in the Grand Hotel and as the name promises it is truly grand.

The grounds are nothing short of amazing and are the first thing you notice when you drive up to the hotel.

The reception staff were welcoming and this is where you start to get a taste of the old world charm of the hotel. It rambles over 3 wings and 3 floors with lots of different nooks and crannies all oozing charm.

The rooms were large and comfortable. Although  there is no air conditioning or fan it is not really needed in the cool climate.

There are quite a few eating options with the a large dining room buffet, separate Al a Carte restaurant, Thai (downstairs); and an Indian Restaurant and Cafe in the gardens. We tried the Indian , the  Al a Carte and the Cafe and found the food very good.

The only slight disappointment is the service staff at the Al a Carte and Breakfast Buffet. The service was okay but not what you would expect of a luxury hotel. At times the staff were often inattentive, missing in action or chatting to other staff. At breakfast only one waiter was serving tea and coffee in a very large dining room and I found I was not the only guest chasing a staff member down to try and get my coffee in the morning. This did not however detract much from our overall stay (just something for management to address)
title: Truly a Grand Experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for your kind words and for recommending The Grand Indian! We're thrilled to hear you had a great time and that Praba made your experience extra special with his warm and helpful service. The Murg Makhani is indeed a guest favorite, and we're glad you enjoyed it.

We look forward to welcoming you back for another memorable meal.

Warm regards,
The Management
The Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya
placeInfo/address: Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya - Heritage Grand
text:
The drive up to the hotel and its lovely gardens, would not be out of place in an Agatha Christie film. Check in was from the lounge and we were shown to our room on the top floor, small, but furnished in colonial style. 
This was the first hotel we actually got lost in, trying to find the restaurant, a member of staff appeared and was happy to show us . 
Had breakfast, buffet style, it had a good selection of dishes and cooking stations. The room was huge and felt a little like a canteen. 
The indoor pool was great, with stained glass roof and beds. Spa treatments were available.
title: Colonial Style

text:
We stayed at this beautiful colonial hotel for 1 nughr on the way Yala National Park. 

We had pre ordered a breakfast to takeaway the afternoon before as we needed to leave at 6am.

On checking our at 5.45am our breakfasts had not been ordered. The male reception staff on duty at the time was a 23 year old called Ruvinda. He was absolutely brilliant and sorted this out for us within 10 minutes. His English was perfect and he put me at ease by taking g the stress away. He chatted to me whilst the breakfasts were being made. Thank you so much and well done Ruvinda!
title: Excellent Customer Service

roomTip: We stayed here in April, so the days were very hot, but there was no relief in the rooms. It was close to Horton Plains NP.
text: Whilst the surrounds (gardens and restaurants within the hotel complex) were beautiful our room - booked as a “deluxe” room was anything but. It was small, noisy and airless. I acknowledge that there was a “heritage clause” attached to this building but it had no fan, no Airconditioning and when we endeavoured to cool the room by opening a large casement window, our room filled with aggressive mosquitos. The band playing at a restaurant below us pulsated through our room until late into the night and children running up and down the corridor carried straight into our room. Not a pleasant stay that is for sure.
title: Beautiful gardens but terrible rooms.

text:
I had a truly wonderful stay at The Grand Hotel in Nuwara Eliya. From the moment I arrived, the staff were exceptionally kind, supportive, and professional. I want to give special mention to Kumar, the Chief Concierge, who took the time to show me around the hotel and share the fascinating historical background of this iconic property. His warm hospitality and knowledge added so much value to my visit.expecial thanks goes to Amin and Gimhani and Kalahari to help me during my stay .

Every member of the team—from the front office managers, reception staff, to the kitchen team—was friendly, helpful, and made me feel genuinely welcome. The level of service was consistently excellent throughout my stay.

This hotel is not only one of the most beautiful in Sri Lanka but also rich in history and colonial charm. It’s a place where tradition meets luxury, and every corner tells a story.

I highly recommend The Grand Hotel to anyone visiting Nuwara Eliya. Whether you’re looking for elegance, comfort, or a glimpse into Sri Lanka’s past, this hotel offers it all
title: Excellent experience

ownerResponse/text:
Sehr geehrter Herr Naß,

herzlichen Dank, dass Sie sich die Zeit genommen haben, Ihre Eindrücke Ihres erneuten Aufenthalts im Jetwing Blue mit uns zu teilen. Es freut uns außerordentlich, dass wir Sie auch bei dieser Reise wieder von unserem Haus überzeugen konnten.

Ein besonderes Dankeschön für Ihre wertschätzenden Worte über unsere Teammitglieder. Es erfüllt uns mit großer Freude zu hören, dass Sie sich durch Niroshan so herzlich betreut gefühlt haben. Sein Engagement, seine Freundlichkeit und sein hoher Anspruch an Servicequalität spiegeln genau die Werte wider, für die wir bei Jetwing stehen. Wir werden Ihr Lob mit großer Freude an ihn weitergeben.

Ebenso bedanken wir uns für die freundliche Erwähnung von Rochell und Benoit aus dem Guest Relations Team. Dass Sie sich durch sie nicht nur professionell, sondern auch persönlich gut aufgehoben fühlten – und sogar in Ihrer Muttersprache Benoit kommunizieren konnten – freut uns ganz besonders.

Ihre Anregung hinsichtlich einer festen Zuordnung von Roomboy und Servicekräften während des gesamten Aufenthalts nehmen wir gerne auf und prüfen dies im Rahmen unserer Qualitäts- und Serviceoptimierung.

Es war uns eine Ehre, Sie erneut bei uns begrüßen zu dürfen, und wir hoffen sehr, Sie bald wieder im Jetwing Blue willkommen zu heißen.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Ihr Guestrelation-Team
text:
Ein optimales, sehr ansprechendes und komfortables Hotel direkt am Strand gelegen und in relativer Nähe zum Flughafen. Das Personal grundsätzlich aufgeschlossen, hilfsbereit und zuvorkommend. Besonders dabei zu erwähnen ist mein Roomboy Niroshan, der mich von Anfang an mit seinem herzlichen Wesen, seiner Freundlichkeit, seiner Arbeitsleistung sowie dem Bestreben, alle meine Wünsche zu erfüllen, vollkommen überzeugt hat. 
Daneben fielen im Bereich Guest Relation Management Rochell durch ihr immer lächelndes und zuvorkommendes Wesen sowie Benoit als aufmerksamer Ansprechpartner auf. Von herausragendem Vorteil war auch, dass man sich in seiner Muttersprache unterhalten konnte.
Wünschenswert wäre eine dauerhafte Zuordnung von Roomboy und Waiter während des gesamten Aufenthaltes. 
Alles in allem aber immer wieder eine Reise wert. 
Heinz-Jürgen Naß
title: Eine weitere Reise nach Sri Lanka ins Hotel Jetwing Blue...

Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us. We deeply regret to hear that your stay at Jetwing Blue did not meet your expectations, and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and discomfort you encountered.

Please accept our sincerest apologies for the condition of the room upon your arrival and for the flooding caused by the blocked balcony drain during the heavy rainfall. This is certainly not the experience we aim to provide our guests, and we are truly sorry for the distress it caused you.

We take all guest feedback very seriously and have already addressed the drainage issue with our maintenance team to ensure that such occurrences are prevented in the future. Additionally, we are reviewing our room inspection protocols to guarantee that rooms are fully secured and in optimal condition before guest check-in.

We understand how frustrating it must have been to deal with these issues, especially after a long journey, and we are very sorry that we failed to offer the comfort and care that our guests deserve. Your experience is not reflective of the standards we strive to uphold, and we are taking your comments as an opportunity to improve.

Should you consider giving us another chance, we would be grateful for the opportunity to offer you a more pleasant and restful stay.

Best regards,
The Jetwing Blue Team
text: I checked in to Jetwings Blue at 2330 hours and the place looked haunted and poorly unkept. My notions were proved wrong when I woke next morning to find the room was wet because the balcony door was open and air con was on. Next 2 days were even worse - it rained heavily in Colombo and my room would get flooded with rain water because the balcony drain was blocked, rain water accumulated in balcony, the winds would blow water from below the doors into the room. Internet was marginal. Resturant food was below average. Lifts were poorly maintained. For the price the hotel charged the services were 3rd class. AVOID THIS PROPERTY.

ownerResponse/text: Dear Peter …Thank you for your heartfelt and honest feedback. We truly appreciate your kind words about the unique landscape architecture, the tranquility of the surroundings, and the opportunity to unwind at our pools, each with its own charm. The experience of having resident monkeys visit your balcony must have been quite a delight. We’re glad our team’s quick response helped resolve your room issue and that their warm hospitality made your stay more enjoyable. It’s also great to hear that you found the bar pricing reasonable and that your transport arrangements were handled smoothly. While the hotel’s popularity draws many visitors eager to experience its distinctive design, we understand that this may not always suit those seeking complete privacy, and we appreciate your understanding.  Your feedback regarding the dining options on the second and third nights has been noted, and we will certainly review how we can enhance both variety and quality. Continuous improvements are always in progress to ensure our facilities align with evolving guest expectations while preserving the character that makes Heritance Kandalama so special. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for recommending us as a place to visit. We would be delighted to welcome you again and ensure your stay is just as wonderful and filled with cherished memories. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book early as it sells out due to large tour groups. Take the half board option, and try to secure a room in the Sigiriya wing.
text:
We stayed three nights in a Luxury Room in the Sigiriya Wing. The Heritance Kandalama is a massive and incredibly unique hotel - over 900 metres from one end of the Dambulla wing to the other end of the Sigiriya wing. 

The hotel is incredibly popular with large tourist groups (coaches and coaches worth) so if you are planning to stay here, book very early. We had a lot of difficulty securing a room at the hotel and were unable to book directly as they were sold out. We secured a room via a third party site, but not the one we were hoping for. We were on the third floor and had a partial lake and Sigiriya view. 

We had an issue with our room upon arrival (despite at least five pre arrival emails to the hotel), however it was resolved quite quickly after check in. 

The rooms are dated, but very comfortable and with good amenities. Everything worked fine and the AC and the bedding were great. The different types of resident monkeys visited our balcony and outside our bathroom daily which we quite enjoyed. 

The property and gardens / landscaping are beautiful and extremely unique. The infinity pool has incredible views over the lake and towards Sigiriya and the rooftop pool with the base of the pool the bed rock the hotel is built on is extremely unique and very cool. 

As the hotel has so many tour groups, it is very busy early in the mornings and in the evening, but super quiet and peaceful during the day when they are out.

We did the half board option which is highly advisable considering the isolated lakeside location. Breakfast was great every day, even when very busy with a good range of options. Dinner was great the first night, however the quality and range of options was a little poor on the second and third nights. 

We arranged transport out to Sigiriya for sunrise and for an elephant safari through the hotel and both were fantastic with good quality drivers and vehicles.

We found all staff at the hotel absolutely exceptional and friendly. The hotel bar charges in rupees which makes drink prices quite reasonable. 

We would absolutely recommend the Heritance Kandalama and really enjoyed our stay.
title: Heritance Kandalama brilliance

ownerResponse/text: Dear Gjoz…. It’s wonderful to hear that your return to Heritance Kandalama after nearly two decades was just as enjoyable as you remembered. Our team takes great pride in delivering warm hospitality, and it’s especially rewarding to know that their dedication stood out to you—from the reception to the poolside. We’ll be sure to pass along your kind words to the gentleman working on the lacquered railings near room 407—our team members love sharing their craftsmanship and anecdotes that make our property unique with guests. ownerResponse/text: Dear Ruth and Priya,….Thank you so much for sharing your wonderful experience at Heritance Kandalama. We’re thrilled to hear that your stay was such a memorable part of your Sri Lankan journey. We’re especially glad that the architecture, food, and service remain such a cherished memory. It’s great to know that you enjoyed the natural beauty surrounding the hotel, including the pools, wildlife, and stunning sunsets. We’re also delighted to hear that your cultural experiences, such as walking with the monk and exploring the historical sites, were meaningful and spiritually enriching. We truly appreciate your kind words about our staff and their commitment to providing you with excellent service. It’s wonderful to hear that their hospitality made your stay even more special. We hope to welcome you back to Heritance Kandalama for another unforgettable experience in the future. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Heritance Kandalama was one of the highlights of our trip to Sri Lanka, and we left with a deep sense of appreciation for this unique and beautiful hotel. From the moment we arrived, we were in awe of the striking architecture—this hotel is truly one of the most beautiful buildings we’ve ever seen. Designed by the legendary Geoffrey Bawa, it is perfectly sympathetic to the surrounding forest, blending seamlessly with nature and offering breathtaking views at every turn.

The food at Heritance Kandalama was amazing—a brilliant buffet. The variety was exceptional, and the quality was even better. We particularly loved the hoppers, daal, and the delicious selection of breads and fruits. There were also plenty of international food options for those who wanted them, ensuring that everyone’s tastes were satisfied. Every meal felt like a treat, and we enjoyed trying the local specialties every day.

The hotel’s three pools were a highlight, with the infinity pool offering the most breathtaking views of the nearby lake. It was the perfect place to unwind and take in the serene, peaceful surroundings. The entire hotel felt like an oasis—lush, beautiful, and incredibly calming. We spent time relaxing by the pools, soaking in the views, and enjoying the natural beauty all around us.

The nature surrounding the hotel is extraordinary. We loved watching the monkeys play and observing the wild birds that seemed to be everywhere. The sounds of the forest added a peaceful ambiance, making it easy to relax and feel truly connected to the environment. And the sunsets! They were simply incredible, casting a golden glow over the lake and the forest, creating a memory we’ll cherish forever.

The service at Heritance Kandalama was another standout feature. The staff were brilliant—professional, friendly, and attentive. They clearly take pride in their work and are great ambassadors for the hotel. This was our first experience of Sri Lanka, and we couldn’t have been made to feel more welcome. The staff were not only helpful but also genuinely interested in us, always going the extra mile to make sure we were comfortable. Nothing was too much trouble for them, and their warm hospitality made our stay even more memorable.

We also had the privilege of experiencing some incredible nearby attractions. One of the standout experiences was walking with a monk. This meditation experience, where we visited caves and received the monk’s wisdom on the side of a mountain, was truly moving. It was a privilege to be in such a breathtaking setting and learn about Sri Lankan culture and spirituality.

We also climbed Sigiriya and Pidurangala, both of which were unmissable. While the sites can be crowded, the views from the top, especially at sunset, were absolutely worth it. The Dambulla caves, with their ancient and solemn atmosphere, made us feel like we were stepping back in time. The sense of history surrounding us was palpable, and we felt privileged to visit these sacred places.

Overall, Heritance Kandalama provided the perfect setting for a peaceful retreat—luxurious, connected to nature, and full of exceptional experiences. The combination of striking design, amazing food, brilliant service, and the chance to connect with nature made this stay unforgettable. We absolutely loved every moment and can’t wait to return. 

Ruth and Priya
title: Beautiful setting; extraordinary hotel

ownerResponse/text: Dear Sue ….Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us! ownerResponse/text: Dear Valued Guest…..  Thank you for your heartfelt words about your experience at Heritance Kandalama. It brings us great joy to know that our architecture, cuisine, service, and natural surroundings created such a surreal and memorable stay for you. Your kind acknowledgment of Shantha and the front office team is truly appreciated—they take great pride in ensuring every guest feels welcomed and well cared for. It was an absolute pleasure to have you with us, and we hope to welcome you back for another remarkable stay. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: Kandalama is an unreal experience. The architecture, the food, the service and the nature is truly unbelievable. We have traveled the world to so many resorts and this has by far been one of the best experiences we have had. Shantha at the front office and his team has to be given a special shout out for their flexibility.
title: Kandalama is a true gem

ownerResponse/text: Dear Kasun,…Your words aptly describes the true essence of Heritance Kandalama, and we couldn’t be more grateful for your beautiful sentiments. It’s wonderful to hear that you felt the soul of the hotel and experienced its unique charm, from the architecture blending with nature to the flavors that awakened your taste buds. We’re especially glad that the little details, like the music controller in the bathroom, added to your experience. Thank you for your kind appreciation—it means a lot to us. We hope to welcome you back to this “man-made heaven” for another unforgettable stay. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: I think that hotel has a unique taste. It feels like that hotel has a good soul inside it, i have never tasted such tasty foods.buffet wakes up our taste buds , hospitality is in another level. You should visit this man made heaven even one time in your life. Its beauty collaberated with nature gives a strange romance feeling, even u a have music controller in your bathroom, everything is centrally controlled , cheers for the unique and wonderful hotel in Sri Lanka
title: Unforgettable stay, i think that hotel has life..that much it feels

ownerResponse/text: Dear Rasika….It’s truly heartwarming to hear that Heritance Kandalama has been a cherished part of your visits to Sri Lanka since 1996. Your continued trust and appreciation mean so much to us. Geoffrey Bawa’s vision of blending architecture with nature is something we take great pride in and knowing that it continues to resonate with you is incredibly rewarding. Shanthakumar and the front office team will be delighted to hear your kind words. We can’t wait to welcome you back for another wonderful stay. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Kandalama is a family favorite each time we visit SL. Has been going there since 1996 and the service and food is simply the best. Amazing blend with nature in true Geoffrey Bawa design. ShanthaKumar, front office manager  and his team took care of all the details!
We will be there again soon!
title: Tranquil paradise

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Esteemed Guest,
​
We are truly grateful for your gracious review. It brings us immense joy to know that your visit with us was a memorable one.

Your kind words will be shared with the entire team—they will be deeply honored by your recognition.

We would be delighted to welcome you back for another indulgent escape. During your next visit, we invite you to explore our signature dining destinations: 1864, Fire Beach, and Traveler’s Bar—each offering a curated culinary journey, thoughtfully designed to reflect the elegance and spirit of GFH.

We eagerly await the pleasure of your return, where luxury, warmth, and exquisite experiences await.

With sincere appreciation,

Noel – GFH

text: his grand dame has kept well since my last visit a decade ago. Siddique’s team will check you in while you sip your welcome drink. Your journey back to the colonial days has begun. Check out the photo gallery of those who have spent some nights here over the the dame’s 160 year shelter. Tapas at the Firebeach is worth checking out. So is King of the Mambo. Ideally located, Galle Face suits me and I will be back.
title: Still grand, this dame

text:
We had a truly memorable experience at the iconic Galle Face Hotel in Colombo today. The setting is absolutely stunning — a perfect blend of colonial charm and seaside elegance. We especially enjoyed the high tea on the terrace, with breathtaking views of the Indian Ocean and the gentle sea breeze adding to the ambience.

A special mention goes to Krishma, who made our high tea experience even more exceptional. She was warm, attentive, and incredibly professional — ensuring that everything ran smoothly and that we felt well taken care of throughout. Her thoughtful service really stood out and added a personal touch to an already wonderful afternoon.

Galle Face Hotel continues to uphold its reputation for timeless elegance and outstanding hospitality. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Colombo!
title: A Perfect High Tea by the Sea – Thanks to Krishma!

ownerResponse/text:

Granbell Team.
text: My stay at Granbell Hotel in Colombo has been fantastic. The location is perfect, right by the sea and close to the city’s major attractions. My sea-view room was spacious and spotless, with a large bathtub. The hotel is modern, cozy, and very clean. The highlight was the infinity pool and jacuzzi on the 27th floor, offering stunning views of the city and ocean. Staff were incredibly friendly and reflected true Sri Lankan hospitality. The buffet dinner was delicious, especially the Sri Lankan dishes. Although there is nothing really negative about my stay, the pool area is small with limited sunbeds, and the Japanese restaurant is a bit pricey due to added taxes. Overall, a memorable stay and highly recommended to anyone visiting Colombo.
title: Perfect stay with stunning views and warm Sri Lankan hospitality

text: Our last SL hotel and worthy of 4 stars. We ate at the pool bar and had cocktails, a great space and sunset. Only negative is smoking and bottles and glasses in the pool, that’s a trashy look !. The surrounding area is a bit grim so we dined in at the buffet, extraordinary selection and presentation turned out to be great value. Breakfast again a large selection but chaotic with cramped tables and a large school group of teens, picking up food by hands. It’s a large hotel and big numbers of guests I guess. Again another rooftop pool and Sri Lankan sunset.
title: Wide sea and city views, 4 stars

Fantastic spread at the Easter lunch.  The food was lovely and the service was great.  Really appreciate how Amila and Sudheera attended to our needs, helping us change our table so we'd get an amazing view of the ocean so my kid could watch trains while we ate. The staff was really helpful especially going out of the way to prepare different pasta dishes for our son. Thanks for a lovely afternoon.  
Also, shout out to the helpful and kind reception staff. Extremely professional.  
All in all, a wonderful first time at Granbell. Looking forward to many more.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for your wonderful and comprehensive review!

We’re so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay and appreciated our central location, rooftop views of the Lotus Tower, and the unique touch of our service robot. It’s heartening to know that our team’s courtesy and professionalism stood out during your time in Sri Lanka — and we’re especially glad we could offer a packed breakfast to make your early departure a little easier.

We do acknowledge the liveliness of the Dutch Hospital area on weekends, and we appreciate your understanding as we balance the energy of the neighborhood with guest comfort.

It was truly a pleasure to host you and your family, and we hope to welcome you back again soon for another memorable stay!
placeInfo/address: No. 07 Hospital Street, Colombo 00100 Sri Lanka
text:
Fantastic location, although on a Saturday night quite a bit of noise from the live music at the Dutch Hospital complex right next door. Air con from other rooms noisy, staff amazing - the most courteous and professional we experienced in Sri Lanka, they even have a robot that will bring room service to you. Fantastic view of the Lotus Tower from their bar on the roof.

We had to leave for a flight before breakfast, so they offered us a packed breakfast without us even asking and, whilst waiting for it in the lobby, they had their robot deliver our daughters to her.

The hotel location is fantastic, close to many of the main sights, and those that aren't close are a short tuk-tuk away which costs around £1 to £2 for each trip.
title: Definitely worth staying

Director General Manager
text:
Pleasant Stay with Outstanding Staff, But Disappointing Food

The hotel itself is lovely, and the staff were truly exceptional. From the moment we arrived, we were treated to outstanding service. Elwin helped us with the check-in process and graciously gave us a tour of the property, including the charming herb garden and a visit to the rooftop—just in time to witness a stunning sunset.

Unfortunately, the dining experience fell well below expectations. We had booked a half-board package, but after trying the dinner buffet on the first night, we chose to dine elsewhere at our own expense for the rest of our stay. The breakfast buffet was equally underwhelming—disappointingly, even a simple omelette wasn’t prepared well. We struggled to find a single dish that was enjoyable at either meal.

While the hospitality and overall ambiance deserve high praise, the quality of the food significantly detracted from our experience. I sincerely hope management addresses this issue, as it prevents an otherwise excellent hotel from earning a full five stars.
title: Pleasant Stay with Outstanding Staff, But Disappointing Food
